stimulusHtml:
At barbari, consilio Romanorum cognito, praemisso equitatu et essedariis, quo
 plerumque genere in proeliis uti consuerunt, reliquis copiis subsecuti nostros navibus
 egredi prohibebant. Erat ob has causas summa difficultas, quod naves propter
 magnitudinem nisi in alto constitui non poterant, militibus autem, ignotis locis,
5impeditis manibus, magno et gravi onere armorum oppressis simul et de navibus
 desiliendum et in fluctibus consistendum et cum hostibus erat pugnandum.

Bellum Gallicum 4. 24

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. What are the case and use of the pronoun quo (line 1) ?

2. What are the case and use of navibus (line 2) ?

3. In this passage, which three Latin words indicate that the Britons were aware of what Caesar intended to do?

4. In lines 3-6 (Erat . . . pugnandum), which two Latin words indicate where the Romans were able to anchor their ships?

5. Identify the grammatical construction of impeditis manibus (line 5).

6. (A) Identify the grammatical construction erat pugnandum (line 6) and (B) translate it in context.

7. In lines 3-6 (Erat . . . pugnandum), (A) which two Latin words indicate where the Britons eventually force the Roman soldiers to fight? (B) Translate them in context.

8. In lines 3-6 (Erat . . . pugnandum), which one Latin word refers to the Briton soldiers attacking the Romans?

9. Briefly describe what Caesar does to use water to his advantage against the Helvetians, besides destroying the bridge at Geneva, in Book 1 of the Bellum Gallicum. Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.
